thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Cooler Accessory (WDH-638)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Develops Cooler Accessory (WDH-638) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Develops Cooler Accessory (WDH-638)
text:
InventHelp, a Pittsburgh-based invention submission company, is submitting the MULTI COOLER to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 11, 2015
"When the weather gets so hot that working outdoors puts you at risk of dehydration, many stores sell buckets of water bottles," said an inventor from Mitchelville, Md. "But they do not provide anything to keep the water cold. That inspired me to invent this cooling bucket device."
He developed the MULTI COOLER to keep bottled and canned beverages cold and drinkable. The accessory also keeps food items, bait and other items cool. The unit ensures that cold food and drinks are readily available. This saves individuals from having to consume warm drinks. Furthermore, it is designed to be reusable, and it is adaptable for use with any five-gallon bucket.
The original design was submitted to the Washington D.C. office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 13-WDH-638, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
